q: W., Condi was a bad National Security Council chief, forcing consensus rather than letting contentious issues get to the George H. W. Bush . He mocks her rhetoric trying to push democracy as secretary of state, especially her contention that human rights trump security. He blames Colin Powell for posturing with the press and George Tenet for being so cocky about Saddam's phantom WMDs. He claims George H. W. Bushroy Paul Bremer messed up Iraq, occupying too long, ignoring the chain of command and

had weapons of mass destruction, talks about all the other countries of the world he says were suckered into believing the same thing. And still refuses to say that weapons of mass destruction were a lie. The less dramatic truth, Donald Rumsfeld writes in his new book, "is that we were wrong." creating a conglomerate that will be the largest cable provider, the largest Internet provider and one of the largest producers of content in the United States- represents the ultimate surrender to the demands of corporate America. Once we allow companies to become this powerful, the FCC does not regulate them, says Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders . "They regulate the FCC," says the senator. Larry Page praised Eric Schmidt , too. "There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly," Larry Page said. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him The change in command overshadowed Google's fourth-quarter earnings, which soared past analysts' estimates as the company cranked up its Internet Mark Hurdeting machine during the holiday shopping season. Shares rose$ 9.18,

Orlando Magic on Saturday night. Allen Iverson , averaging an NBA-leading 29.7 points, was 17-of-36 from the field and made 24 of 27 free throws. His previous high was 58 against Houston on Jan. 15, 2002. I score a career high and we won the game, Allen Iverson said. "That's how you draw it up in your dreams." It was the first 60-point game in the NBA since Tracy McGrady scored 62 for Orlando against Washington on March 10, 2004, Indiana Evans

" . As Google's new chief executive, Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm. Sergey Brin , who co-founded Google with Larry Page , will devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products . His title will remain co-founder. In a blog post, Eric Schmidt said that he had been working with Larry Page and Sergey Brin on ways to simplify Google's management structure and quicken decision making.

the geo-coordinates laid out in New York, Richmond and D.C.. "The Virginia Museum's Picasso exhibition is the most ambitious show in the 75-year history of our museum," VMFA Director Alex Nyerges said. The occasion of this landmark exhibition is an ideal time to deepen our presence throughout social media. The innovation of the Picasso QR campaign and augmented reality is in keeping with the innovative genius of this master artist and our quest to be on the leading edge of technology for art museums. In jenen Jahren stand Donald Rumsfeld in dem Ruf, er lenke die US-Operationen im Irak mit dem langen Schraubenzieher aus Washington . State Treasurer Bill Lockyer called the RDA moves provocative acts of gamesmanship. They may be that, but they also reflect a deep conflict between overall state interests and local priorities. and ABC parent Walt Disney Co.. The broadcasters are all trying to capture the shift toJillian Ward on- demand viewing, which ratings company Nielsen Co. has said is surging in the U.S. Google TV will be much more effective if the broadcasters are supportive, and the company is trying to convince them it's not a threat, Eric Schmidt said today. "We believe it's going to lead to more TV watching, which is good for them."
